decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The operations, comprising the replacement of existing windows and new render finish to the external walls, would consist of alterations to the dwelling house within the meaning of Class A of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class A. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 2 - The operation, comprising the erection of a single storey front porch, would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class D of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class D. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 3 - The operations, comprising the erection of a rear roof dormer and insertion of 3 rooflights on the front roofslope, would consist of the enlargement and alteration to the roof of the dwellinghouse within the meaning of Classes B and C of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Classes B and C. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 4 - The erection of a new front boundary brick wall would be compliant with Class A of Part 2 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class A. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE: 
The applicant should be aware that the site may provide a useful habitat for swifts. Swifts are currently in decline in the UK and in order to encourage and improve the conservation of swifts the applicant is advised to consider the installation of swift nesting box/bricks on site.
description: APPLICATION FOR A LAWFUL DEVELOPMENT CERTIFICATE IN RESPECT OF THE PROPOSED ERECTION OF A REAR ROOF DORMER, INSERTION OF 3X ROOFLIGHTS ON THE FRONT ROOFSLOPE, REPLACEMENT FRONT PORCH, NEW 1M FRONT BOUNDARY BRICK WALL,  REPLACEMENT OF EXISTING WINDOWS TO MAIN DWELLINGHOUSE AND NEW CEMENT RENDER TO EXTERNAL WALLS.
